page.title: 14Ecology - Migrating Birds
page.content: In addition to observing the birds the Obervatory is also a base for ringing birds. Most of the birds ringed at the observatory are quite common, but the grand total of species recorded mounts steadily, and now stands at 238. A total of 250 species by the end of the century is by no means improbable. Each recovery of a ringed bird, alive or dead, adds a little more to our knowledge of the annual movements of that particular species, for every ring has a number which is unique to that individual bird. Three "heligoland" traps have been built on the island. These are effectively large open mouthed funnels of wire netting, narrowing down to a catching box. When ringing is taking place bird are encouraged down it. They are then taken out identified, weighed,measured and ringed.
